Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The purpose of the present study was to determine if elevated reactive oxygen ( ROS ) / nitrogen species ( RNS ) reported to be present in adriamycin ( ADR ) - induced cardiotoxicity actually resulted in cardiomyocyte oxidative / nitrative damage , and to quantitatively determine the time course and subcellular localization of these postulated damage products using an in vivo approach .

Let's think step by step.

| Disease |
| --- |
| adriamycin-induced cardiotoxicity |
| cardiomyocyte oxidative / nitrative damage |

Explanation:

* "adriamycin-induced cardiotoxicity" is a disease condition caused by the administration of the drug Adriamycin, leading to toxicity in the heart.
* "cardiomyocyte oxidative / nitrative damage" is a condition where there is damage to the cardiomyocytes (heart muscle cells) due to oxidative and nitrative stress.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Disease |
| --- |
| adriamycin-induced cardiotoxicity |

Explanation:

* "adriamycin-induced cardiotoxicity" is the only clear disease entity in the paragraph.
* "cardiomyocyte oxidative / nitrative damage" is not a disease itself, but rather a description of damage caused to cardiomyocytes due to oxidative and nitrative stress.
